docna.cdata!:
Burma - Tank Irrigation Project : Credit
            1315 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Burma - Tank Irrigation Project :
            Credit 1315 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

18152050.admreg: East Asia and Pacific,East Asia and Pacific

abstracts.cdata!:
The Myanmar Tank Irrigation Project
            consists of two subprojects, each located in distinctly
            different regions, namely, Kinmundaung and Azin. The
            Kinmundaung subproject lies in Magwe Division in the dry
            zone of central Burma. The subprojects will provide
            year-round irrigation for about 5,000 acres, irrigation for
            a dry-season crop in the area, and a full drinking water
            supply for Mudon Town which has a population of about
            40,000. At full development, cropping intensities will
            almost double for both subprojects; incremental paddy
            production will total about 8,100 tons p.a. With the
            introduction of cotton and orchard crops, the project will
            assist the government of Burma's efforts toward crop
            diversification while increasing the value of non-paddy cash
            crops by about K8.8 M per year. The project will introduce
            furrow irrigation to the Kinmundaung area for the first
            time. In addition, both subprojects will introduce new crops
            such as Long-Staple Cotton (LSC) and a 850 ac irrigated
            orchard scheme.

The Myanmar Tank Irrigation Project
            consists of two subprojects, each located in distinctly

            Kinmundaung subproject lies in Magwe Division in the dry

            40,000. At full development, cropping intensities will
            almost double for both subprojects; incremental paddy
